bill.title: Sex Offender Registration
bill.description: Adds comparable foreign convictions and tribal convictions to covered offenses; makes offenders who are subject to sex offender registration or notification in their jurisdiction of conviction, covered offenders under Hawaii law; makes it clear that a covered offender must register and report the offender's permanent residence, current temporary residence, or if an address is not available, a description of the place or area in which the covered offender resides; amends the definition of "conviction" in section 846E-1, Hawaii Revised Statutes, to clarify that conviction, for purposes of sex offender registration, occurs on the date judgment is entered; creates a tier classification for any covered sexual offenses that are not clearly included within the current tier classification law; addresses the problem of covered offenders who do not have registered residences to which the post office can deliver mail and cannot receive the ninety-day verification mailings by requiring these offenders to report in person once per month; and repeals the definitions of "mental abnormality, "personality disorder," and "predatory."

referrals.name: Public Safety, Government Operations, and Military Affairs

history.action: (S) The committee(s) on PGM has scheduled a public hearing on 02-09-12 2:45PM in conference room 224.
(S) The committee(s) on PGM deferred the measure until 02-14-12 2:45PM in conference room 224.

(S) The committee(s) on PGM recommend(s) that the measure be PASSED, UNAMENDED. The votes in PGM were as follows: 3 Aye(s): Senator(s) Espero, Kidani, Baker; Aye(s) with reservations: none ; 0 No(es): none; and 2 Excused: Senator(s) Ryan, Slom.
(S) Reported from PGM (Stand. Com. Rep. No. 2269) with recommendation of passage on Second Reading and referral to JDL.
(S) Report adopted; Passed Second Reading and referred to JDL.
